document_data.name: ''Symbol of the Martyr''
document_data.mainbody: '''''Symbols of the martyr''''' were powerful ''[[holy symbol]]s'' used by [[cleric]]s of the [[Church of Mystra]] in the 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Powers: ''Symbols of the martyr'' resembled a single silver star of the goddess of magic [[Mystra]], martyred in her death at the hands of [[Cyric]] and [[Shar]]. These particular ''holy symbols'' possessed magics that blazed with energy when their owners suffered harm. When a ''symbols of the martyr'' ignited, it boosted the owner's attacking powers, [[spell]]s' damage, and dramatically improved punishment dispensed with especially lucky hits, both magical and physical. Additionally, it powered the owner's healing magics, and when the cleric was surrounded by enemies, the healing magics were empowered dramatically.
document_data.History: In the late-15{{th}} century DR, a ''symbols of the martyr'' could be recovered from a bandits' camp run by [[wizard]] [[Desram]], hidden in the [[Sword Mountains]], later raided by adventurers in service of [[Neverwinter]]. Another such ''holy symbol'' was stashed in the ruins of [[Illefarn]] among other treasures of the [[vampire lord]] named [[Ozit]], lastly, they were used by [[Thayan]] [[Red Wizard]] who performed ungodly magical experimentations on monsters in the [[Neverwinter Wood]].
